title: Calories in Cocktail Shrimp
meta_description: Discover calories in cocktail shrimp per 100 g serving, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown for easy tracking.
assumptions: Peeled, deveined, cooked (boiled or steamed), chilled; no added sauce, salt, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by shrimp size, cooking method, added salt, and preparation; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cocktail shrimp provides ~99 kcal and ~24 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: With 1 tbsp cocktail sauce per 100 g
Breaded and fried (vs. boiled) per 100 g
Add 1 tsp olive oil for sautéing per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g cocktail shrimp?
faqs.a: About 99 kcal for 100 g cooked, peeled cocktail shrimp.

faqs.q: What's the protein in cocktail shrimp?
faqs.a: Roughly 24 g protein per 100 g, making it a lean seafood option.
Very low—only 0.2 g carbs per 100 g, with 0 g fiber and sugars.

faqs.q: Is cholesterol high in cocktail shrimp?
faqs.a: Yes, about 161 mg per 100 g, mostly from the natural shrimp content.

faqs.q: How does preparation affect calories in cocktail shrimp?
faqs.a: Boiled/steamed is lowest; frying or adding sauce can add 25–100 kcal per 100 g.
